content: laine on the butt miniskirt/cowl ` laine french noun feminine /lɛn/ - wool do you ever throw on a pair of leggings and find yourself wondering if they re a bit sheer are you concerned that the cropped styles of the current 90 s fashion revival leave your lower half very exposed to the elements do you want another layer between your backside and the seats of your chosen mode of public transportation do you like clothing that is edgy chic and versatile if you answered yes to any of these questions you ve found your pattern this sophisticated skirt is quick and easy to make and is suitable for a relative beginner it is seamless and requires only a knowledge of how to knit and purl and use a circular needle the sizing is very forgiving and customizable so it makes a great gift and since two garments are always better than one it does double-duty as an elegant bulky cowl so what are you waiting for get your knit together and cast on 1 things you need and need to know yarn 2-3 skeins 250-375m/272-408 yds of diamond luxury traditional chunky 125m/136yds per 100g or any similar weight heavy worsted yarn colourway pictured is 1803 needles 24in 60cm 5mm circular needle us 8 or size to obtain gauge 24in 60cm 6mm circular needle us 10 or size to obtain gauge other handy items - a row marker - a craft needle for weaving in yarn ends - a measuring tape gauge 15 sts and 18 row per 4in 10cm square sizing please note that this skirt is quite stretchy and is designed to have some negative ease aka cling the size chart below represents the finished measurements of the skirt itself but it will stretch 4-5 inches horizontally to accommodate a larger body measurement if you wish to wear it only as a cowl the extra small size will fit as shown in the photos the larger sizes will make lovely longer draped cowls when in doubt swatch swatch swatch size waist hip length extra small 25in/63cm 30in/76cm 17in/43cm small 28in/71cm 34in/86cm 17in/43cm medium 32in/81cm 38in/96cm 17in/43cm large 35in/89cm 42in/106cm 18in/46cm extra large 38in/96cm 46in/116cm 18in/46cm pattern abbreviations k knit p purl co cast on ideally a fairly stretchy cast-on the sample pictured used long-tail k1p1 rib to create this ribbing just knit 1 stitch then purl 1 stitch and repeat until the pattern tells you to stop when knitting in the round as in this pattern it is vital that you have an even number of stitches cast on for this ribbing otherwise you will end up with a lovely but very un-stretchy moss/seed stitch 2 pattern instructions xs s m l xl co 96 108 120 132 144 sts or any multiple of 12 sts to obtain desired size on 5mm circular needle and join to knit in the round being careful not to twist place marker at start of round knit in k1p1 rib for
